result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine A. FREUND was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Continue with treatment presently in.  

Submit DNA sample.

ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 10-15-15 at 2:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

List of Items Demanded
List of Items Moved for in Discovery.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.

Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.
The petition is denied because the court finds the person is not indigent.
